alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Franklin; Jefferson; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 2:48PM CDT until July 14 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Franklin County in east central Kansas... Southeastern Jefferson County in northeastern Kansas... Douglas County in east central Kansas... Northeastern Osage County in east central Kansas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 247 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Williamstown to 3 miles southeast of Overbrook, moving east at 35 mph. THESE ARE DESTRUCTIVE STORMS! HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. * Locations impacted include... Lawrence, Ottawa, Baldwin City, Eudora, Wellsville, Overbrook, Centropolis, Perry, Lecompton, Clinton, Lone Star, Pleasant Grove, Vinland, Williamstown, Clinton Lake and Globe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 187 and 198. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 190 and 205. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
